name: Heritage Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in room #394 with king bed. The room was a good value for the price – $139 as part of a wedding party. Comfy bed, some natural light. Bathroom had good counter space. Check in was easy and the staff was friendly. We were at hotel for a wedding and the staff working the wedding were great. Free wifi (it’s always odd to me that cheap hotels offer free wifi while many expensive hotels do not). Could have used a few more amenities in the bathroom such as a shower cap. The property is large – pool area was great and there is a game area for kids. Plenty of places to sit throughout hotel and read/catch up on email. The front desk did seem a little short staffed at times. We had room service and the portions were huge. For the price a very good deal.
reviews.title: Very good for the price, comfy beds, nice staff

reviews.text: I just celebrated my birthday here with my friends and family. This hotel is just about an hour away from NYC Area and is a great get away. They have amenities included like Pool, a room for playing Wii, several areas where families can meet and gather to play games, talk, eat. In addition they have an indoor pool, sauna, steam room, hot tub, ping pong Raquet ball which can be converted into volleyball if you have at least 6 people to have a game! It is also located near several vineyards so you can drive and within 20 minute have a wine tasting. The hotel rooms are pretty spacious, some are update some are a bit more classic but all are neat and you can get connecting rooms on request. With Triple A or government ID you get really good discounts through the hotels rewards site (I-prefer) Overall the value is good. Even the Pub in the hotel is priced affordably. With their I prefer rewards at check in you get a little gift too which is normally something good like a flight of wine, cheese platter or chocolate! I'm not sure what the breakfast cost because it was included in my room however it seems a good value because it is buffet but also has a made to order station. I've been several times already but the last two times everyone loved the location (Fall with my Alumnae Chapter with 9 women and the other in February 2012 for my birthday and we booked at least 5 rooms. Its good for family/friend reunions, a quick get away or even kids.
reviews.title: Great Value and great activities

reviews.text: We went to the Heritage Hotel last minute with the kids for a night to enjoy the indoor pool. Everything was really nice and clean. The pool was warm and there is a lovely gym attached with sauna, steam room, and racquetball. The staff was very friendly and accommodating throughout the hotel- front desk, gym, housekeeping, and restaurant. Recommended for a night or 2 for a quick getaway from NYC.
reviews.title: Great for a stay with the kids!

reviews.text: We found your hotel extremely accomodating. we were a group of 4 mothers and 10 children. The children enjoyed the facilities - the lounging area and pin pong table, the swimming pool and racquet ball courts. Every request was immediately accomodated - we asked for two additional roll out beds at 10:00 Pm and received them without any problems. The price was right for us as well. Even your location within walking distance from Friendlys worked for us. We will definitely come back again. Thank you!
reviews.title: Excellent value family friendly hotel

reviews.text: Three families joined the Heritage Hotel for the winter break - we went skiing nearby in Waterbury - via Groupon ski deal. The hotel is not bad, beds were comfortable, room clean, amenities for kids and families were good - Ping Pong, Billards, Board Games, WII, pool, gym raquet ball etc. Grounds were nice. Service was good, everyone very friendly and they let you congregate throughout the hotel without giving you a hard time. Downfalls of the hotel - bathroom - mine was in disrepair, the shower door kept falling off, the Bedroom Window was broken and would not open. The restaurant is in dire need of a new Chef. Pub Grub offerings are fine. But the main entrees and salads were terrible.
reviews.title: Comfortable for Groups...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Heritage and loved every minute of it. Its a great place to relax - pool was wonderful.
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing stay

reviews.text: It was our first time at the Heritage Hotel. We came for New Years Eve, 12/31-1/1, with our two kids, ages 4 & 6. We went snow tubing in Woodbury, about 10 mins away. Kids loved the pool, food was great for dinner and breakfast, very reasonable. The room was big and very clean. We will definitely be coming back.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because it is conveniently located and has racquet ball courts and an indoor pool. Staff (front office, restaurant, fitness club) was very friendly and professional. After settling in, we noticed that our room had some issues (water leaking from the ceiling, toilet flush malfunctioning. A front office personnel promptly offered to switch the room. Since we checked in late and the children already asleep, we did not change our room. We were partially compensated for the inconvenience. Fitness Club is clean and functional. Our stay was transient (on the way to MA), and it served its purpose.
reviews.title: Friendly and professional staff; faciities need improvement

reviews.text: We were surprise to find the hotel nestled between the trees in a beautiful scenic area. The staff were professional and very helpful in giving information about the Antique Stores and kosher locations, (which needed updated information).The room was large, very clean and neat. The bed linen was bright white and of quality comfort. The view from the window was very relaxing. It was a joy to get away from the noise of New York City for a very short stay and experience the beauty of nature in a wonderful setting.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: Beth Bouley and Joe Bouley were extremely helpful in meeting our needs. We plan to return soon for another wonderful break at the Heritage Hotel. We have passed on the information about the hotel to our friends and family members.
reviews.title: Excellent Job

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came here for a snowboarding getaway weekend. I booked the bed&breakfast rate.
reviews.title: great find, tasty breakfast buffet

reviews.text: Great experience from the get-go. We got to check-in early on a Sat morning which was nice because we were heading to the Woodbury Ski Area (not recommended) later on.
reviews.title: Family friendly & top notch service

reviews.text: We got a King sized room on the 3rd floor which has higher and slanted ceilings. Bed was comfy and room was spacious. Nothing special about the bathroom.
reviews.title: A Hotel That Cares About You

reviews.text: The fitness area was very nice. There are 2 racquetball courts but 1 was set up for volleyball. FYI bring sneakers if you want to play in there. Pool towels are available behind the fitness desk. The indoor pool was a good size, not too many kids in there when we went. Jacuzzi was nice and really hot. They have an outdoor pool too but it was covered for the winter.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: For some reason there was no breakfast buffet on Sat morning but they offered a la carte items. They did have breakfast buffet on Sun which was very tasty. Hot station included pancakes, home fries, sausage/bacon, scrambled eggs and oatmeal. There was an omelet station. Tons of fruit, bagel/muffins, cereal. Service was great.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Heritage is a fine country hotel in Heritage Village in Southbury, CT. Rooms are clean and adequate. There is a nice indoor (and outdoor) pool and a fine gym. A bar, a restaurant and an arcade round up the hotel amenities. The coffee maker in the room is a nice touch. Bathrooms are small but adequate. We stayed there last weekend for one night. The hotel is very loud, walls paper thin. Stay away from rooms near the elevator.
reviews.title: Good country hotel (but loud!)

reviews.text: Stayed there with 3 adults and 4 kids under 10 years old. It was cold, so we were resigned to stay inside. Not a problem, never had to leave the hotel. Could play ping pong, raquetball, swimming....
reviews.title: Great for kids & adults

reviews.text: Ate/drank at the restaurant and it did not disappoint. Staff was friendly and helpful -- particularly Tiffany and Michelle.
reviews.title: Super Hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A romantic getaway with fall foliage and antiques!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here so that we could visit my parents for a short weekend. It was our first stay and we didn't really know what to expect. Our arrival was not a good one - after driving 7+ hours on a friday evening, we got to our room to find that it had not been cleaned from the previous guests. I was pretty unhappy and called room service. Mo sent two housekeeping staff up pretty quickly. They were super - very apologetic and immediately started stripping the beds and attacking the room We were on our way out to dinner with the folks so they had some time without us there to complete the job. When we returned, the room was spotless. Mo offered us a free dinner, but my husband suggested that two mornings of complementary breakfasts for us and out 8 year old son would be better for us.
reviews.title: Great place to stay! Great staff!

description: Welcome to The Heritage! Each of our hotel's 163 spacious guest rooms and suites at The Heritage Hotel is freshly decorated to reflect a timeless New England Style, many with views of the Pomperaug River and golf course. Our love of hospitality is easy to see and amenities such as Sealy® pillow-top mattresses, New England® coffee in your room and an attentive staff demonstrate our passion for every facet of your stay.
